intro: Capurodendron antongiliense, commonly known as the Antongili spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and dry forest habitats, thriving in arid conditions. It has smooth, waxy leaves and produces small, clustered fruit capsules. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
